page.title: 09Cank Thorn
page.content: Opposite the Commonwealth War Cemetery we found a tree called Cank Thorn, planted on the site of the original tree which marks the meeting place of three ancient manors. It is referred to in the records of "beating the bounds" of Berkswich Parish in the 18th century. The tree grew until 1971 when it was broken off, but a sucker survived. The mysterious thing is that this tree is not found growing wild anywhere in the world. It is a hybrid of a tree introduced from N.America in 1656, so perhaps Cank Thorn may have been the first of its kind. It is a bushy tree about 3m tall. The dark green glossy leaves are broad with toothed edges. The 2cm long thorns are brownish purple. The creamy white flowers are followed by red berries in autumn.
